<script>
$(function() {
	var embedUrl = '{$embedUrl}';
	var code = $('textarea[name="code"]');
	var codeUnit = code.parents('dl');
	codeUnit.hide()
	$('select[name="size"]').change(function() {
		var size = $(this).val();
		if (size) {
			var sizeSplit = size.split('x');
			codeUnit.fadeIn();
			code.val('<iframe src="' + embedUrl + '" width="' + sizeSplit[0] + '" height="' + sizeSplit[1] + '" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" style="border-width: 0;"></iframe>').focus().select();
		} else {
			codeUnit.fadeOut();
		}
	});
});
</script>

Position Criteria

This criteria allows you to target specific threads, posts and page results.

To display ads inside the first post, to the right side of the message, select position Inside Post x Message under "Thread Post" position category and set Item ID option to 1.

Threads
This option works with the following positions:

  • Global Positions (Header, Above Top Breadcrumb, Below Top Breadcrumb, Below Bottom Breadcrumb, Above Content, Below Content, Footer)
  • Thread Positions (Thread View Above Messages, Thread View Below Messages)
  • Thread Post Category Positions (Inside Post x Message, Below Post x Message, After Post x Container)

Note: When using Global Positions, you have to set the Page Criteria option "Content Template is:" to thread_view if you want the ads to display only on thread pages.

Search
This option works with the following positions:

  • Global Positions (Header, Above Top Breadcrumb, Below Top Breadcrumb, Below Bottom Breadcrumb, Above Content, Below Content, Footer)
  • Search Page Position (Search results after x result)

Note: When using Global Positions, you have to set the Page Criteria option "Content Template is:" to search_results if you want the ads to display only on search results pages.

Page Criteria

This criteria allows you to target specific nodes, pages and sections.

To display ads only on the homepage (forum list), use a Global Position or a Sidebar Position and set Page Criteria option "Content Template is:" to forum_list

To hide ads on login, registration and error pages, set Page Criteria option "Content Template is NOT:" to register_form, login, login_password_confirm, error, error_with_login

User Criteria

This criteria allows you to target specific users based on user groups, achievements, options and user data.

Privileges and Status
If you check multiple options, they all need to be true in order to validate. For example, if you check "User is a guest" and "User is logged in" it won't validate because a user cannot be a guest and logged in at the same time.

Date Criteria

This criteria allows you to display ads based on date and week days in specific time zones.

Device Criteria

This criteria allows you to target specific devices used by visitors.

Geo Targeting
